channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024051688
item.description:
Report X-2024051688

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: LAWNSIDE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED AND SORTED AND ENDED UP IN SMALL SORT ARB. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD SLIGHT FUMES. THE PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED AND RETURNED TO QC WHERE THE DAMAGE WAS DISCOVERED. THE LEAKING CONTENTS WERE SOLIDIFIED AND BAGGED.

item.title: Report X-2024051577
item.description:
Report X-2024051577

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING UNLOADING MANAGER NOTICED PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. I THEN SECURED IT AND VENTILATED THE PACKAGE SAFELY AND PROPERLY. I REPACKED THE 1 DAMAGED BOTTLE INTO ITS OWN DRUM AND THE OTHER 3 WERE REPACKED INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SEPERATELY. APPROXIMATELY 1 OUNCE LEAKED FROM 1 OF THE 4 BOTTLES DUE TO A HOLE IN THE LID/CAP. AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW.

item.title: Report X-2024051587
item.description:
Report X-2024051587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: LAWNSIDE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BEING LOADED INTO AN OUTBOUND TRAILER FOR SHIPPING. AS THE PACKAGE WAS BEING HANDLED, IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING.THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED OUTSIDE TRAILER AND A SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED. THE SPILL WAS CONTAINED TO THE AREA AND THE CLEANUP WAS COMPLETED AND RETURNED TO QC FOR PROPER HANDLING.

item.description:
Report X-2024051490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: KEASBEY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURINNG THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT, UPON INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES OF RAPICIDE PART B WASFOUND TO BE LEAKING. THE MAIN BOX OF THE PACKAGE WAS MISSING, THE REMAINING CONTENTS HAD NO VISIBLE DAMAGE THEY WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE.
